key_channel_insights.line_content: Consistent high match rates above 85%, but unavailability rose sharply, indicating more missing fares.
Fares are predominantly cheaper than the website, offering around a 9–11% discount despite growing coverage gaps.
Over 84% price alignment with no premium, though overall unavailability crept up by around 5%.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 85% of itineraries are priced the same as the website last week.
Instances of 'OTA N/A' reached 12.5% last week, almost doubling from the prior period.
OTA-lower fares remain nearly absent across all segments.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: At 12.5% last week versus 6.5% prior, reflecting more missing offers.
Dominant at 87.5% last week, down slightly from 93.5% previously.
Effectively zero last week, continuing its minimal presence.
Remains below 1% with no notable shifts week over week.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA N/A rose from about 6.7% to 14.6%. Over 85% remain priced the same.
OTA N/A edged up from 6.1% to 8.1%, with over 91% matching website fares.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA N/A climbed to 18.1% from 9.7%, the highest among POO. Most others remain matched.
OTA N/A is minimal at 3.4%. Nearly all fares match website rates.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: OTA N/A reached 15%, up from 8.7%. Pricing remains identical for 85% of these bookings.
OTA N/A stands at 4.4%, slightly higher than 2%. Over 95% remain the same as the website.

mse_highlights.line_content: Nearly 90% to 98% of fares are lower on MSE, indicating consistent undercutting of the website's prices.
MSE Not Available rates show a slight increase, moving from about 6% up to 11% in some segments.
Across most segments, MSE undercuts the website by around 9–11% on average each week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Observed frequencies range from 2% to over 14% in certain segments, suggesting modest but growing coverage gaps.
No meaningful occurrence in the latest data; near 0% across all segments.
Dominant status, holding upwards of 85% to nearly 100% share, with a steady 9–11% price edge below the airline's site.
No data points indicate MSE fares exceeding the website’s prices this period.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: About 86% of itineraries are cheaper on MSE with a roughly 10% discount; N/A coverage rose from 7% to 14% week to week.
Roughly 92% of fares are lower on MSE, sustaining a 10% discount; around 8% are not listed on MSE.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 80% of fares priced under website levels, with a slight increase in not-found offers from 9.6% to 18.1% in the weekly data.
Above 98% of itineraries undercut the website, and N/A rates remain minimal at around 2% or less.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Roughly 85% cheaper on MSE with a 10–11% discount; N/A rates have inched up to nearly 15%.
MSE offers are near 96%–100% cheaper, consistently around a 9% discount; N/A remains under 5%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 84% of fares remain identical to the airline website, indicating stable alignment.
GDS unavailability climbed up to 12% overall from last week, with sharper rises on short-haul routes.
No instances of higher GDS fares were detected across all examined markets.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Up to 12% of all fares missing on GDS, reflecting a 5% week-over-week increase.
Dominates at roughly 88% overall, though slightly down from the previous week’s share.
Minimal at around 1%, up from nearly 0%, suggesting sparse but growing fare advantages.
No instances observed in any region or booking window.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: 14.6% unavailability (up nearly 8%), but 84% of fares match the site.
8% unavailability and a 2% uptick from last week, with 92% pricing aligned.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 18% GDS unavailability, 81% match, reflecting a 9% dip in same-fare coverage.
Only 1.7% unavailability with a steady 98% price alignment from week to week.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 15% GDS unavailability, rising 6% weekly; the majority of fares still match the website.
4% unavailability with 93% matching, and 2% registering as lower than the website.
